article.headline: Rhode Island 85, Iona 60
article.story: SOUTH KINGSTOWN, R.I. (AP) -- Will Daniels scored 18 points to lead Rhode Island to an 85-60 win over Iona on Tuesday night. Daniels got a pair of free throws and scored the last two baskets in a 17-2 Rhode Island run near the end of the first half to pull ahead 39-24 at the break. Parfait Bitee added 13 points for Rhode Island (4-3), Jon Lucky chipped had 12 and Jimmy Baron scored 11. Iona (0-4) closed within 43-33 after De'Shaune Griffin made a 3-pointer with 18:09 left but Rhode Island responded with an 11-2 run, including 3-pointers from Bitee, Lamonte Ulmer and Baron, to open up a 20-point advantage. Anthony Bruin had 17 for Iona, Griffin had 13 and Alejo Rodriguez and Justin Marshall scored 10 each. Iona had to do without Kyle Camper, who broke his right foot in practice on Monday. Camper had started all three games for Iona and was averaging 7 points per game and leading the team with 14 assists. Rhode Island's largest lead was 67-41 when Ulmer scored a basket with 8:27 to play.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
